entries.definition: The branch of medicine dealing with the study, diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of cancer.
A group of diseases characterized by uncontrolled cell growth and invasion into surrounding tissues.
An abnormal mass of tissue that can be benign or malignant (cancerous).
A new, abnormal growth of tissue in the body, which can be benign or malignant.
A type of cancer treatment that uses chemicals to kill cancer cells.
A type of cancer treatment that uses high-energy rays to kill cancer cells.
A medical procedure used to treat cancer by removing a tumor or affected tissue.
A type of cancer treatment that uses the body's immune system to fight cancer.
A subtype of cancer cells that have the ability to divide and grow into new tumors.
A type of cancer treatment that targets specific genetic mutations in cancer cells.
